supporting_text: The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including infection prevention and control measures.
The NAP outlines measures for responsible use of antibiotics in animal husbandry and veterinary care.
The NAP addresses the minimization of emissions of antibiotics and antimicrobial substances to the environment.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of antibiotic resistance in food production and its impact on food security.
The NAP includes provisions for annual reports on the results from surveillance of resistance and antibiotic use.
The NAP mentions specific targets such as the national '250 target' for antibiotic prescriptions.
The document does not specify any budget allocations for the strategies.
The NAP mentions a national collaborative function comprising 25 government agencies and other organizations.
The NAP includes the expectation that antibiotic resistance and infection prevention will be included in relevant basic education and professional training.
The NAP emphasizes the need for coordinated communication initiatives to raise public awareness about antibiotic resistance.
The NAP states that Sweden will support WHO, FAO, and OIE in efforts to tackle AMR.
The NAP outlines the need for improved data collection and surveillance systems for antibiotic resistance.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of early detection and reporting of antibiotic resistance.
The NAP includes objectives focused on infection prevention and control measures in healthcare and veterinary settings.
The NAP aligns with international standards and practices to minimize and contain antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP discusses the importance of responsible prescribing and regulation of antibiotics.
The NAP mentions the need for a strong legislative framework to support responsible antibiotic use.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP highlights Sweden's participation in international research cooperation on antibiotic resistance.
